titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Robinson Brown Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr.

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 08:25

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Business correspondence, articles, speeches, and the manuscripts of Brown's book, Our Forest Heritage: a History of Forestry and Recreation in New Hampshire (1958), forestry studies, and Congressional bills. Includes papers relating to the Brown Company of Berlin, New Hampshire (manufacturer of paper products, chemicals, and other wood-using products), the American Forestry Association, New Hampshire Disaster Emergency Council, New Hampshire Forestry Commission, North East Forest Research Council, Society for the Protection of New Hampshire Forests, Society of American Foresters, and the Timber Lands Mutual Insurance Company.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Robinson Brown Papers (MS 107). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in three series: I. Correspondence. II. Topical Files. III. Manuscripts.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Chairman of the New Hampshire Forestry and Recreation Commission, 1910-1952; active in various forestry organizations in the 1930s; author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Business correspondence, articles, speeches, and the manuscripts of Brown's book, Our Forest Heritage: a History of Forestry and Recreation in New Hampshire (1958), forestry studies, and Congressional bills. Includes papers relating to the Brown Company of Berlin, New Hampshire (manufacturer of paper products, chemicals, and other wood-using products), the American Forestry Association, New Hampshire Disaster Emergency Council, New Hampshire Forestry Commission, North East Forest Research Council, Society for the Protection of New Hampshire Forests, Society of American Foresters, and the Timber Lands Mutual Insurance Company.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

scopecontent.p: This series contains files arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.p: This series contains files arranged alphabetically by topic.
